list_definition.definition: a thick sticky substance made of fruit etc preserved by being boiled with sugar

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The gateway to the embassy was jammed with angry protesters.

list_definition.definition: to squeeze, press or wedge tightly or firmly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He jammed his foot in the doorway.

list_definition.definition: to stick and (cause to) be unable to move
(of a radio station) to cause interference with (another radio station’s broadcast) by sending out signals on a similar wavelength

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The device can jam navigational signals.

list_definition.definition: a crowding together of vehicles, people etc so that movement is difficult or impossible

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They’re stuck in a traffic jam.
I’m in a bit of a jam – I haven’t got enough money to pay for this meal.
